column1: Jack is in the kitchen in his house. Jack wants a cold drink from the refrigerator. The refrigerator is full of fresh food. Suddenly, a power cut changes the state of the food in the refrigerator to spoiled. Jack opens the refrigerator to get a cold drink.
column2: Does Jack think the food in the refrigerator is fresh or spoiled?
column3: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is fresh.
column4: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is spoiled.

column1: Caden is in his new house. Caden wants to fix all the things that are not right. There is a big leak in the roof. Suddenly, the sun comes out and dries up the leak. Caden plans to call a man to fix the leak.
column2: Does Caden think there is a leak in the roof or has the sun dried it up?
column3: Caden thinks there is still a leak in the roof.
column4: Caden thinks the sun has dried up the leak.

column1: Vivi is in her room playing with her toys. Vivi wants to lay her small, patient triangle toy on the shelf with her other toys. The triangle toy is in her toy box. Suddenly, her baby brother crawls into the room and takes the triangle toy. Vivi lays the triangle toy on the shelf.
column2: Does Vivi believe the triangle toy is in her toy box or that her baby brother has taken it?
column3: Vivi believes the triangle toy is in her toy box.
column4: Vivi believes her baby brother has taken the triangle toy.

column1: Emma is in her room after a long day at school. Emma wants to draw on her white bathrobe to make it look creative. The bathrobe is plain and white. Suddenly, a spill from a bottle of bleach changes the bathrobe from white to a patchy white and yellow. Emma plans to start drawing on her bathrobe.
column2: Does Emma think the bathrobe is plain white or patchy white and yellow?
column3: Emma thinks the bathrobe is plain white.
column4: Emma thinks the bathrobe is patchy white and yellow.

column1: Ollie is at the beach building a sand castle. Ollie wants to dig a deep hole with his spade. The spade is sharp and safe to use. All of a sudden, a wave from the sea splashes on the spade making it slippery and dangerous. Ollie continues to dig the hole with the spade.
column2: Does Ollie think the spade is safe or dangerous?
column3: Ollie thinks the spade is safe.
column4: Ollie thinks the spade is dangerous.

column1: Ben is at the train station. Ben wants to catch the train to go to work. The train is on time. Suddenly, a signal fault delays the train and makes it late. Ben plans to get on the train and start working on his case.
column2: Does Ben think the train is on time or late?
column3: Ben believes the train is on time.
column4: Ben believes the train is late.

column1: Pia is at her school library. Pia wants to read a mystery book. The mystery book is on the top shelf. Suddenly, a tall boy moves the mystery book to the bottom shelf. Pia plans to ask for help to reach the top shelf.
column2: Does Pia think the mystery book is on the top shelf or the bottom shelf?
column3: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the top shelf.
column4: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the bottom shelf.

column1: Chloe is at a fair in her town. Chloe wants to hug the fireman at the fair. The fireman is very friendly. Suddenly, a loud noise scares the fireman and he becomes very scared. Chloe walks up to the fireman to give him a hug.
column2: Does Chloe think the fireman is friendly or scared?
column3: Chloe thinks the fireman is friendly.
column4: Chloe thinks the fireman is scared.

column1: Wendy is at a yard sale in her town. Wendy wants to buy a beautiful bracelet she saw. The bracelet is shiny and cheap. Suddenly, a famous collector recognizes the bracelet and its value increases to an expensive price. Wendy plans to buy the bracelet.
column2: Does Wendy think the bracelet is cheap or expensive?
column3: Wendy thinks the bracelet is cheap.
column4: Wendy thinks the bracelet is expensive.

column1: Yara is in her room with her favorite teddy bear, Stitch. Yara wants to hide Stitch so her little brother cannot find him. Stitch smells like yummy vanilla because Yara sprayed him with her vanilla perfume. Suddenly, a spilt bottle of vinegar changes the scent of Stitch to sour. Yara hides Stitch under her bed.
column2: Does Yara believe Stitch smells like yummy vanilla or sour vinegar?
column3: Yara believes Stitch smells like yummy vanilla.
column4: Yara believes Stitch smells like sour vinegar.

column1: Nia is in her home, ready to bake a cake. Nia wants to bake a cake in the oven. The oven is in good working order. Suddenly, a small earthquake shakes the house and the oven breaks. Nia begins to mix the ingredients for the cake.
column2: Does Nia think the oven is in good working order or broken?
column3: Nia believes the oven is in good working order.
column4: Nia believes the oven is broken.

column1: Amy is walking in the park. Amy wants to sit on a bench and rest. The bench is covered with pretty vines. Suddenly, a gardener sprays the vines with a substance that changes them from non-harmful to harmful. Amy moves towards the bench to sit down.
column2: Does Amy believe the bench is safe or not safe?
column3: Amy believes the bench is safe.
column4: Amy believes the bench is not safe.

column1: Kate is in the park with her old toy car. Kate wants to drive the toy car on the clean cloth she brought. The cloth is clean and spread on the grass. Suddenly, a dog runs across the park and makes the cloth dirty with its muddy paws. Kate starts to drive the toy car on the cloth.
column2: Does Kate think the cloth is clean or dirty?
column3: Kate believes the cloth is clean.
column4: Kate believes the cloth is dirty.

column1: Ella is at the park with her parent. Ella wants to complete her ice cream before it melts. The ice cream has a sweet taste. Suddenly, a gust of wind blows some sand onto the ice cream, changing its taste to gritty. Ella continues to eat her sweet ice cream.
column2: Does Ella think her ice cream is sweet or gritty?
column3: Ella thinks her ice cream is sweet.
column4: Ella thinks her ice cream is gritty.

column1: Uma is in her room with a big clock on the wall. Uma wants to move the clock to another room. The clock is brown. Suddenly, a splash of paint from a passing parade changes the color of the clock to rainbow. Uma plans to lift the clock and move it to another room.
column2: Does Uma think the clock is brown or rainbow?
column3: Uma believes the clock is brown.
column4: Uma believes the clock is rainbow.

column1: Fred was at the park with his friends. Fred wanted to play a beautiful song on his trumpet for his friends. The trumpet was in his bag. Suddenly, a gust of wind blew leaves over the bag, hiding the trumpet from sight. Fred was going to take out his trumpet and play a song.
column2: Does Fred think his trumpet is in his bag or hidden from view?
column3: Fred believed his trumpet was in his bag.
column4: Fred believed his trumpet was hidden from view.

column1: Amy was in her room playing with her toy angel. Amy wanted to make the angel fly in the air. The angel's wings were open wide. Suddenly, a gust of wind struck and the angel's wings closed. Amy throws the angel in the air to make it fly.
column2: Does Amy believe the angel's wings are open or closed?
column3: Amy believes the angel's wings are open.
column4: Amy believes the angel's wings are closed.

column1: Sally is inside her house, thinking about the garden outside. Sally wants to plant flowers in the earth. The earth is dry and warm. Suddenly, while Sally is still inside, a heavy rain cools the earth. Sally starts to plant the flowers in the earth.
column2: Does Sally think the earth is dry and warm or cool and wet?
column3: Sally believes the earth is dry and warm.
column4: Sally believes the earth is cool and wet.

column1: Dora is at the farm with her dad. Dora wants to ride the big, hairy horse. The horse is standing in the field. Suddenly, a loud noise from a passing truck scares the horse and it lies down on the grass. Dora walks towards the horse to ride it.
column2: Does Dora think the horse is standing or lying down in the field?
column3: Dora thinks the horse is standing in the field.
column4: Dora thinks the horse is scared and lying down in the field.

column1: Ben was at the park playing with his dog. Ben wanted to make his dog's hair look nice by brushing it. The dog's hair was very safe to touch. Suddenly, a bee stung the dog making its hair dangerous to touch due to the dog's allergic reaction. Ben continues to brush his dog's hair.
column2: Does Ben believe the dog's hair is safe or dangerous to touch?
column3: Ben believes the dog's hair is safe to touch.
column4: Ben believes the dog's hair is dangerous to touch.

column1: Lila was in an ancient city. Lila wanted to walk on the ancient road. The road was full of old stones. Suddenly, an earthquake shook the ground, causing the stones of the road to be cracked and destroyed. Lila planned to walk on the ancient road.
column2: Does Lila think the road is full of old stones or destroyed?
column3: Lila believes the road is full of old stones.
column4: Lila believes the road is destroyed.

column1: Quinn was at the park on a sunny day. Quinn wanted to unite his friends for a fun event. Their picnic basket was full of food. Suddenly, a sneaky raccoon emptied the picnic basket while no one was looking. Quinn plans to start the event with the food in the picnic basket.
column2: Does Quinn believe the picnic basket is full or empty?
column3: Quinn believes the picnic basket is full.
column4: Quinn believes the picnic basket is empty.

column1: Harry was at the park with his little red wagon. Harry wanted to ride his wagon down the big hill. The wagon was safe and sturdy. All of a sudden, a loose wheel made the wagon very dangerous. Harry planned to ride his wagon down the hill.
column2: Does Harry think his wagon is safe or dangerous?
column3: Harry thinks his wagon is safe.
column4: Harry thinks his wagon is dangerous.

column1: Omar was on a beach during the day. Omar wanted to find a special shell hidden under the palm trees. The shells were hidden under the sand. Suddenly, a playful dog ran over and scattered the sand, making the shells visible. Omar plans to dig under the palm trees to find the shells.
column2: Does Omar think the shells are hidden under the sand or visible on top of the sand?
column3: Omar believes the shells are still hidden under the sand.
column4: Omar believes the shells are now visible on top of the sand.

column1: Quentin was at the farm with all the animals. Quentin wanted to feed the goat. The goat was in the organized pen. Suddenly, a group of kids playing nearby left the gate open, allowing the goat to wander into a hot, sunny area. Quentin reaches for the goat food to feed the goat.
column2: Does Quentin think the goat is in the organized pen or in the hot, sunny area?
column3: Quentin believes the goat is in the organized pen.
column4: Quentin believes the goat is in the hot, sunny area.

column1: Nia was in the attic of her old house. Nia wanted to find her old toy car in the attic. The toy car was charged. Suddenly, a mouse chewed the wires of the toy car and it became discharged. Nia plans to play with the toy car.
column2: Does Nia think the toy car is charged or discharged?
column3: Nia thinks the toy car is charged.
column4: Nia thinks the toy car is discharged.

column1: Yolanda was at a toy store. Yolanda wanted to buy a model car for her little brother. The model car was on the top shelf. Suddenly, an employee moved the model car to a lower shelf. Yolanda considers asking for help to get the model car from the top shelf.
column2: Does Yolanda believe the model car is on the top shelf or on a lower shelf?
column3: Yolanda believes the model car is on the top shelf.
column4: Yolanda believes the model car is on a lower shelf.

column1: Kim was in the park with her friends. Kim wanted to eat her pasta lunch. The pasta was in a plastic box. Suddenly, a stray football kicked by a child broke the plastic box. Kim opens the box to eat the pasta.
column2: Does Kim think the pasta is in a broken or intact box?
column3: Kim thinks the box is intact and the pasta is in the box.
column4: Kim thinks the box is broken and the pasta is on the ground.

column1: Ben was in his room playing with his toy robot. Ben wanted his robot to move and speak. The toy robot's battery was fully charged. Suddenly, the battery drained and became discharged. Ben pressed the button to make the robot speak.

column3: Ben thinks the toy robot's battery is charged.
column4: Ben thinks the toy robot's battery is discharged.

column1: Sam was at a big art show. Sam wanted to buy a creative painting. The painting had a low price. Suddenly, a famous artist praised the painting, which changed its price to very high. Sam plans to buy the painting right away.

column3: Sam believes the painting is low priced.
column4: Sam believes the painting is high priced.

column1: Rita was at the park for a walk. Rita wanted to sit on a clean bench. The bench was clean and dry. Suddenly, a careless person spilled a drink on the bench, making it wet and sticky. Rita decided to sit on the bench.

column3: Zoe thinks the box is open.

column1: Rosa was in her room with her furry cat. Rosa wanted to play music and have her cat sit with her. The music player was fully charged. Suddenly, a power surge discharged the music player. Rosa plays a rhythm on the music player for her cat to enjoy.

column1: Nina was in the garden picking vegetables. Nina wanted to pick some crunchy celery for her salad. The celery was clean and fresh. Suddenly, her brother dumped mud on the garden, making the celery dirty and mushy. Nina plans to pick the celery.

column1: Mae was in her garden. Mae wanted to feed the birds with a worm. The worm was big and juicy. Suddenly, a hungry mole ate the worm, leaving no worm for the birds. Mae goes to give the worm to the birds.
column2: Does Mae believe the worm is big and juicy or that there's no worm?
column3: Mae believes the worm is big and juicy.
column4: Mae believes there's no worm.

column1: Ruby was at the park with her friends. Ruby wanted to skip with her jump rope. The rope was coiled up neatly. Suddenly, a skateboarder went by and the rope got caught in its wheels, leaving it tangled. Ruby plans to start skipping with the rope.

column3: Ruby believes the rope is coiled neatly.
column4: Ruby believes the rope is tangled.

column1: Nellie was in the park with her friends. Nellie wanted to share her pizza with her friends. The pizza box was closed. Suddenly, a dog ran by and knocked over the pizza box, leaving the pizza broken and scattered. Nellie planned to open the pizza box and share the pizza with her friends.
column2: Does Nellie think the pizza is in the box or broken and scattered?

column3: Harry thinks the quiz is easy.
column4: Harry thinks the quiz is hard.

column1: Uma was at the park with her friends. Uma wanted to slide down the big slide. The slide was safe for kids. Suddenly, a loose screw made the slide dangerous. Uma climbs up to slide down the big slide.

column1: Yara was in her room, playing with her toy car. Yara wanted to make the toy car jump off a ramp she had made. The toy car was noisy and running. Suddenly, the battery in the toy car ran out, making it quiet and still. Yara makes the toy car jump off the ramp.

column3: Yara thinks the toy car's battery is charged'.

column4: Dan believes the strawberries are sour.

column1: Kiki was in the garden near the poppy flowers. Kiki wanted to pick a jolly poppy for her mom. The poppy was whole. A squirrel ran by and stepped on the poppy, causing it to be tramples. Kiki reached for the poppy to pick it.
column2: Does Kiki believe the poppy is whole or trampled?

column1: Sam was at the park playing with his toy horn. Sam wanted to show his friends how loud his metal horn could be. The metal horn was at room temperature. As the horn sat outside, the sun's heat changed the horn's state from room temperature to hot. Sam plans to blow the horn to show his friends.
column2: Does Sam think the horn is at room temperature or hot?

column1: Daisy was at a fun party. Daisy wants to share a lovely meal with her friends. The meal was cold and not ready to eat yet. While Daisy talked to her friends, the oven timer went off, which meant the meal was hot and ready to eat. Daisy waits for the food to cook longer.
column2: Does Daisy believe the meal is hot or cold?
